name: Prashanna Raj Pandit
title: Graduate Research Assistant
subtitle: Computer Science Student
bio: Graduate Research Assistant at Southern Illinois University Edwardsville specializing in Data Analytics, ML, Computer Vision, and Deep learning. Passionate about leveraging AI for automation, pattern recognition, and solving real-world problems.

about.intro: I am a Computer Science graduate student at Southern Illinois University Edwardsville (SIUE), specializing in Statistics, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision. I am originally from Nepal, where I completed my Bachelor’s degree in Electronics, Communication, and Information Engineering from Tribhuvan University, Pulchowk Campus—one of Nepal’s leading engineering institutes.
about.description: Currently, I am working as a Graduate Research Assistant, focusing on developing deep learning models for multimodal time-series data, particularly in gait biomechanics and noisy real-world datasets. My work involves end-to-end data processing, model design, and high-performance computing on GPU clusters.
about.interests: I have hands-on experience with TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and OpenCV, and a strong foundation in predictive modeling, data preprocessing, and statistical analysis. My goal is to bridge theory and real-world applications through intelligent, data-driven systems.
about.hobby: Outside of research, I enjoy exploring new technologies, contributing to open-source projects, and engaging with the developer community.

experience.description: Research in gait analysis and AI-based motion understanding using deep learning and signal processing.
responsibilities: Extracted 2D keypoints from 106 video datasets using OpenPose and processed JSON data with Pandas and NumPy to compute gait kinematic features such as stride length, cadence, and joint angles, demonstrating robust data preprocessing methods for scalable AI model development.

Engineered a multimodal dataset for deep neural networks by preprocessing gait time-series data via cubic spline interpolation, Savitzky-Golay smoothing, gait phase detection, and turn removal, aligning with best practices in feature engineering and data preparation.

Developed a logistic regression baseline achieving 72% accuracy and a deep learning model (80K parameters) achieving 88% accuracy on gait classification, showcasing experience in building and optimizing machine learning solutions.

experience.description: Full-stack web development and backend optimization for scalable AI-ready systems.
responsibilities: Designed and deployed the FootBalance-Nepal website with a Flask backend and Sheety API integration, improving SEO score from 71 to 88 and performance score from 81 to 95, demonstrating expertise in scalable web deployment.

Collaborated on full-stack development and optimized backend workflows for scalability and maintainability, reflecting an agile approach and readiness to integrate AI/ML components within larger systems.
Utilized Git for version control to ensure code consistency and facilitate team collaboration, supporting robust software development processes similar to MLOps workflows.

research_interests: Computer Vision and its implementation in automation

achievements.title: Winner – All Nepal Hackathon 2023
achievements.description: Led Vision Architects to victory in the e-Governance category at the All Nepal Hackathon 2023.
achievements.details: Led a three-day hackathon project that automated the four-wheeler driving license test using computer vision for Nepal’s Department of Transport. The solution improved testing efficiency and accuracy, earning first place among national teams.

achievements.title: National TV Interview on Kantipur Television
achievements.description: Featured on Kantipur Television as team leader of Vision Architects following the All Nepal Hackathon 2023 victory.
achievements.details: Discussed the e-Governance project automating driving license tests using computer vision, highlighting its innovation and societal impact. Shared insights on applying AI solutions to public service systems.

achievements.title: Best Paper Award – ICT-CEEL 2023
achievements.description: Received Best Paper Award at ICT-CEEL 2023 for research on automating driving license tests using computer vision.
achievements.venue: International Conference on Technologies for Computer, Electrical, Electronics & Communication (ICT-CEEL 2023)
achievements.details: Honored with the Best Paper Award for the paper 'Automation of Driving License Test using Computer Vision and Image Processing,' recognizing innovation and research excellence in AI-driven automation.

achievements.title: Presented at International Conference – ICT-CEEL 2023
achievements.description: Presented research work on automation of driving license test using computer vision at ICT-CEEL 2023.
achievements.venue: International Conference on Technologies for Computer, Electrical, Electronics & Communication (ICT-CEEL 2023)
achievements.details: Delivered a presentation on developing a vision-based automated driving license test evaluation system, demonstrating practical applications of AI and image processing in transportation and public service systems.

projects.title: iGAIT: Gait Analysis and AI-Based Motion Understanding
projects.short_description: AI-based gait analysis using deep learning and signal processing for motion understanding.
projects.description: Developed a gait analysis system using OpenPose for 2D keypoint extraction from 106 videos, processed data with NumPy and Pandas to compute kinematic features such as stride length, cadence, and joint angles. Built logistic regression and deep learning models (80K parameters) achieving 72% and 88% accuracy, respectively.

projects.title: Music Generation using RNN (Let's Dance!)
projects.short_description: Character-level music generation using LSTM-based RNNs trained on symbolic music data.
projects.description: Implemented an LSTM-based recurrent neural network to generate symbolic music in ABC notation. Used PyTorch to train embeddings, LSTM layers, and softmax output to predict sequential notes. Demonstrated temporal dependency learning and sequence prediction accuracy through iterative sampling.

projects.title: Debiasing Facial Detection Systems
projects.short_description: Implemented CNNs and DB-VAE for bias mitigation in facial detection systems.
projects.description: Developed CNN architectures for facial detection and integrated a Debiasing Variational Autoencoder (DB-VAE) to reweight training samples. Improved fairness by increasing sampling for underrepresented facial features, reducing demographic bias in model predictions.

projects.title: Advanced AI Project: Reinforcement Learning
projects.short_description: Implemented Q-learning and Value Iteration agents for policy optimization and exploration.
projects.description: Implemented Value Iteration and Q-learning agents for policy optimization tasks. Experimented with discount factors, noise, and living rewards to analyze agent behavior in environments such as Pacman and bridge crossing. Developed Epsilon-Greedy exploration and Approximate Q-learning for scalability.

projects.title: MedNLPify: Deep Learning for Biomedical Text Classification
projects.short_description: NLP system for sentence classification in biomedical abstracts using hybrid embeddings.
projects.description: Developed deep learning models with token, character, and hybrid embeddings for classifying 200k PubMed RCT abstracts. Achieved 85.6% accuracy using a Tribrid model and deployed as a Flask web app and Chrome extension for biomedical text classification.

projects.title: Food Vision Project
projects.short_description: Food classification model using transfer learning on the Food101 dataset.
projects.description: Trained transfer learning models (EfficientNetV2B0) with TensorFlow on Food101 dataset subsets. Compared feature extraction vs fine-tuning with and without data augmentation. Implemented checkpointing for best model saving and achieved robust food image classification.

projects.title: ExFS2: User-Space Virtual File System
projects.short_description: Implemented an inode-based virtual file system supporting direct and indirect addressing.
projects.description: Built ExFS2, a user-space virtual file system emulating inode-based storage using C. Supported file creation, deletion, nested directories, and direct/single/double indirect block addressing. Designed bitmap-based allocation and implemented efficient space reuse and scalability.

projects.title: Traffic Sign Classification with Fine-Tuned VGG-16
projects.short_description: Traffic sign classification using fine-tuned VGG-16 with TensorFlow.
projects.description: Fine-tuned a pre-trained VGG-16 model to classify 43 traffic sign classes from the GTSRB dataset. Implemented dataset preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and visualization pipeline. Demonstrated transfer learning performance on limited data.

projects.title: User-Level Threading and Scheduling
projects.short_description: Implemented many-to-one user-level threading with Round Robin and Lottery schedulers.
projects.description: Developed a user-level threading library using ucontext for manual context switching and scheduling. Implemented Round Robin and Lottery schedulers, simulated preemption, yielding, and fairness experiments based on Waldspurger’s Lottery Scheduling paper.

projects.title: Delivery Route Planning Optimization
projects.short_description: Optimized e-commerce delivery routes for Chicago using advanced algorithms.
projects.description: Designed an urban delivery route optimization system using OpenStreetMap data and compared Nearest Neighbor, Quad-Tree, and Floyd–Warshall algorithms for scalability, computational efficiency, and priority-aware delivery. Improved travel distance and runtime performance for multi-depot logistics simulation.

projects.title: Car and Sidelight Detection with YOLOv5
projects.short_description: Real-time detection of cars and sidelights using custom YOLOv5 model with 95% mAP accuracy.
projects.description: Developed a custom YOLOv5 object detection model for real-time detection of cars and sidelights, achieving 95% mean Average Precision (mAP). The model was integrated into the CarSight prototype for automated driving test evaluation, significantly improving the accuracy and efficiency of driving assessments.
features: Custom trained YOLOv5 model with 95% mAP
Integration with CarSight automated testing system
Robust detection in various lighting conditions

projects.title: Google Play Store App Analysis
projects.short_description: Comprehensive analysis of Google Play Store apps using Python and data visualization libraries.
projects.description: Analyzed a comprehensive dataset of Google Play Store applications using Python, Pandas, Matplotlib, and Seaborn to uncover trends in app performance, user ratings, and market dynamics. The project revealed insights into app categories, pricing strategies, and factors influencing user engagement.
features: Data cleaning and preprocessing of large datasets
Statistical analysis of app ratings and reviews
Visualization of trends across app categories
Insights into pricing strategies and user engagement

projects.title: FootBalance Nepal Website
projects.short_description: Professional e-commerce website for FootBalance Nepal footwear company.
projects.description: Developed a modern, responsive website for FootBalance Nepal, a footwear company specializing in orthopedic and comfort footwear. The website features product catalogs, company information, and contact functionality built with modern web technologies.

projects.title: Nobel Prize Winners Analysis
projects.short_description: Statistical analysis of Nobel Prize winners throughout history.
projects.description: Comprehensive analysis of Nobel Prize winners dataset exploring patterns in awards across different categories, countries, and time periods. The project reveals interesting trends in scientific achievements and demographics of laureates.

projects.title: Blog Webapp with User Authentication
projects.short_description: Full-stack blog application with secure user authentication and commenting system.
projects.description: Developed a full-featured blog web application with user authentication functionality using Flask. Users can sign in, create accounts, and comment on blog posts. The application implements secure authentication practices and database management.

projects.title: Flight Finder Bot
projects.short_description: Automated flight price tracker with notification system.
projects.description: Developed an automated bot that tracks flight prices and notifies users when prices fall below their specified threshold. Integrates multiple APIs including Tequila for flight data, Sheety for data management, and Twilio for SMS notifications.

tableau_dashboards.title: Customer Churn Analysis
tableau_dashboards.description: Modeling Frequency of network use and customer complains for an Iranian Telecom Company.

tableau_dashboards.title: Call and Tariff performance
tableau_dashboards.description: Modeling call failures and evaluating tariff plan preference for an Iranian Telecom Company.

certifications.title: 100 Days of Python Bootcamp
certifications.description: Completed a 100-day intensive Python bootcamp covering core programming, OOP, APIs, web development, and automation projects.

certifications.title: TensorFlow Bootcamp
certifications.description: Completed hands-on deep learning bootcamp focused on building, training, and deploying neural networks using TensorFlow and Keras.

certifications.title: IRB – Research in Behavioral Sciences
certifications.description: Completed IRB certification for conducting ethical research involving human participants in behavioral and social sciences.

certifications.title: Model Deployment Bootcamp
certifications.description: Learned how to deploy ML models using Flask, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines, covering best practices in production-ready MLOps.

certifications.title: Agentic AI Bootcamp
certifications.description: Explored building agentic AI systems including planning agents, tool use, and autonomous workflows using modern LLM frameworks.
